newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Highlights of Tuesday's Commission briefing.
newsitem.headline: Highlights of Tuesday's Commission briefing.

text.p: Following are highlights of the midday briefing by the European Commission on Tuesday:
Spokesman Thierry Daman said Wednesday's weekly Commission meeting would start at 1000/0900 GMT.
Daman said Commissioner Ritt Bjerregaard would hold a news conference at 1215/1115 GMT on Wednesday on deliberate release of genetically modified organisms into the environment.
Daman said Bjerregaard's news conference would be followed by a technical briefing to prepare a G7 conference to be held in Bonn on April 7-9 on "G7 - Global market place for SMEs projects".

In answer to a question, spokesman Gerry Kiely said main problem on EU/U.S. veterinary equivalency talks concerned poultry meat and pet meat standards. He said the EU delegation was still in Washington. He also said that meat that did not conform to the EU standards would be refused a certificate to be delivered by the U.S. authorities.

Spokesman Josep Coll i Carbo said Commissioner Manuel Marin and Dutch Foreign Minister Hans van Mierlo would visit Malta on Wednesday and Egypt on Thursday, after having visited Morocco and Tunisia, in order to prepare the ministerial conference "Barcelona II" to take place in Malta on April 15-16.
Coll i Carbo also said the Commission would continue its work in the framework of the Barcelona conference with the hope that further Middle East peace talks would take place.
The Commission released the following documents:
- IP/97/253: Commission takes Japan to WTO for favouring U.S. bidders for satellite system.
- IP/97/256: Albania: Commission approves emergency humanitarian aid worth ECU 2 million.
- IP/97/258: Visit by Commissioner Hans van den Broek to Lithuania and Latvia: focus on enlargement preparations.
- IP/97/260: The external dimension of trans-European energy networks: promoting the inter-connection with third countries.
- Commission provisional agenda for weekly meeting on April 2, 1997.
- European Commission - EC Economic data pocket book.
- Eurostat statistics in focus - Energy and industry No 1997-3: Extract from "Monthly panorama of European industry 3/97".
